info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 2:24PM EST until December 22 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SLIPPERY CONDITIONS EXPECTED WEDNESDAY... .Despite a coastal storm passing south of the area Wednesday the preceding air mass remains quite warm and will invite areas of mixed precipitation through the day. Initially much of the advisory area will see freezing drizzle or freezing rain as precipitation moves in. Once the storm strengthens some of the precipitation near the mountains will change to snow. Close to the coast surface temperatures may warm enough for a change over to plain rain. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 4 PM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Cheshire County. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 4 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Difficult travel conditions are possible due to icy road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
